intro: Hedyotis yazhouensis, commonly known as the Yizhou bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes numerous species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and slender, creeping stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
